article:
I have great memories of the time I spent with my family. But I also have a few  _  memories . The biggest bad memory is of experiencing an earthquake.
The earthquake happened in my hometown in California when I was fifteen. I'll never  _  where I was when the big noises and shaking began. I was in my room reading a  _  in my textbook for an English test. I felt my bed was  _  . The noises got bigger and bigger. I left my room and went in search of my family to  find out  what was going on. I was sure that someone was working on our house and that the shaking would come to a(n)  _  soon. But I was wrong. An earthquake had just  _  my town.
To make a long  _  short, the earthquake we lived  _  was one of the most serious ones that California has ever experienced. In fact, nearly a thousand people  _  their lives that day and in the days that  followed  . Many homes and buildings were  _  in it. My family was  _  enough to get out of our house before the earthquake  _  destroyed it. We  _  it to settle in a neighboring town. How lucky we were!
I'll never forget the way the earthquake  _  my dad. He moved our family from California within a month  _  he was determined to make a safer life for us. He didn't think he was doing his job of protecting us by  _  to stay in a place where an earthquake could strike again  _  any time. I'll never forget that earthquake and the way it changed our  _  .
